background-agents.name: apisec-scan.yml
background-agents.content:
# This workflow uses actions that are not certified by GitHub.
# They are provided by a third-party and are governed by
# separate terms of service, privacy policy, and support
# documentation.

# APIsec addresses the critical need to secure APIs before they reach production.
# APIsec provides the industry’s only automated and continuous API testing platform that uncovers security vulnerabilities and logic flaws in APIs.
# Clients rely on APIsec to evaluate every update and release, ensuring that no APIs go to production with vulnerabilities.

# How to Get Started with APIsec.ai
# 1. Schedule a demo at https://www.apisec.ai/request-a-demo .
#
# 2. Register your account at https://cloud.apisec.ai/#/signup .
#
# 3. Register your API . See the video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MK3Xo9Dbvac) to get up and running with APIsec quickly.
#
# 4. Get GitHub Actions scan attributes from APIsec Project -> Configurations -> Integrations -> CI-CD -> GitHub Actions
#
# apisec-run-scan
#
# This action triggers the on-demand scans for projects registered in APIsec.
# If your GitHub account allows code scanning alerts, you can then upload the sarif file generated by this action to show the scan findings.
# Else you can view the scan results from the project home page in APIsec Platform.
# The link to view the scan results is also displayed on the console on successful completion of action.

# This is a starter workflow to help you get started with APIsec-Scan Actions

name: APIsec

# Controls when the workflow will run
on:
  # Triggers the workflow on push or pull request events but only for the "main" branch
  # Customize trigger events based on your DevSecOps processes.
  push:
    branches: [ "main" ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ "main" ]
  schedule:
    - cron: '20 12 * * 3'

  # Allows you to run this workflow manually from the Actions tab
  workflow_dispatch:


permissions:
  contents: read

jobs:

  Trigger_APIsec_scan:
    permissions:
      security-events: write # for github/codeql-action/upload-sarif to upload SARIF results
      actions: read # only required for a private repository by github/codeql-action/upload-sarif to get the Action run status
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
       - name: APIsec scan
         uses: apisec-inc/apisec-run-scan@025432089674a28ba8fb55f8ab06c10215e772ea
         with:
          # The APIsec username with which the scans will be executed
          apisec-username: ${{ secrets.apisec_username }}
          # The Password of the APIsec user with which the scans will be executed
          apisec-password: ${{ secrets.apisec_password}}
          # The name of the project for security scan
          apisec-project: "VAmPI"
          # The name of the sarif format result file The file is written only if this property is provided.
          sarif-result-file: "apisec-results.sarif"
       - name: Import results
         uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v3
         with:
          sarif_file: ./apisec-results.sarif

background-agents.name: npm-publish-github-packages.yml
background-agents.content:
# This workflow will run tests using node and then publish a package to GitHub Packages when a release is created
# For more information see: https://docs.github.com/en/actions/publishing-packages/publishing-nodejs-packages

name: Node.js Package

on:
  release:
    types: [created]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 20
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm test

  publish-gpr:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 20
          registry-url: https://npm.pkg.github.com/
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm publish
        env:
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN}}

ChatBOT.name: ci.yml
ChatBOT.content:
# AUTO-ATC Playbook v3 - CI/CD Pipeline
# GitHub Actions para testing, linting y validación

name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  # ==========================================
  # VALIDATION JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  validate:
    name: Validate Configuration
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Validate file structure
      run: |
        # Check required directories exist
        required_dirs=("rasa" "n8n" "db" "scripts" "whatsapp" "tests")
        for dir in "${required_dirs[@]}"; do
          if [ ! -d "$dir" ]; then
            echo "❌ Required directory missing: $dir"
            exit 1
          fi
        done
        echo "✅ Directory structure validated"
        
    - name: Validate YAML files
      run: |
        # Check YAML syntax
        find . -name "*.yml" -o -name "*.yaml" | xargs -I {} sh -c 'python -c "import yaml; yaml.safe_load(open(\"$1\"))" _ {}'
        echo "✅ YAML files validated"
        
    - name: Validate JSON files
      run: |
        # Check JSON syntax
        find . -name "*.json" | xargs -I {} sh -c 'python -c "import json; json.loads(open(\"$1\").read())" _ {}'
        echo "✅ JSON files validated"
        
    - name: Check executable permissions
      run: |
        # Check scripts have execute permissions
        if [ ! -x "scripts/provision_chatwoot.sh" ]; then
          echo "❌ provision_chatwoot.sh is not executable"
          exit 1
        fi
        echo "✅ Script permissions validated"

  # ==========================================
  # LINTING JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  lint:
    name: Lint Code
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: '3.9'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        pip install black flake8 isort
        
    - name: Lint Python files
      run: |
        # Check Python formatting
        black --check rasa/ tests/ || (echo "❌ Python formatting issues found. Run 'black rasa/ tests/' to fix."; exit 1)
        
        # Check imports sorting
        isort --check-only --diff rasa/ tests/ || (echo "❌ Import sorting issues found. Run 'isort rasa/ tests/' to fix."; exit 1)
        
        echo "✅ Python code linted"
        
    - name: Check for security issues
      run: |
        # Check for hardcoded secrets
        if grep -r "password\|secret\|token\|key" --include="*.py" --include="*.yml" --include="*.yaml" . | grep -v ".env" | grep -v "example" | grep -v "placeholder"; then
          echo "❌ Potential hardcoded secrets found"
          exit 1
        fi
        echo "✅ Security check passed"

  # ==========================================
  # TESTING JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  test:
    name: Run Tests
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: '3.9'
        
    - name: Install test dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        pip install pytest pytest-cov requests
        
    - name: Install Rasa dependencies
      run: |
        pip install rasa psycopg2-binary qdrant-client
        
    - name: Run unit tests
      run: |
        cd tests
        python -m pytest test_actions.py -v --tb=short
        
    - name: Run integration tests
      run: |
        cd tests
        python -m pytest test_integration.py -v --tb=short
        
    - name: Generate test report
      run: |
        echo "## 🧪 Test Results" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Unit tests: ✅ Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Integration tests: ✅ Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

  # ==========================================
  # DOCKER BUILD JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  docker:
    name: Build Docker Images
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Set up Docker Buildx
      uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3
      
    - name: Validate Docker Compose
      run: |
        docker compose config --quiet
        echo "✅ Docker Compose configuration is valid"
        
    - name: Build test images
      run: |
        # Build images without running (dry run)
        docker compose build --parallel --no-cache
        echo "✅ Docker images built successfully"

  # ==========================================
  # DEPLOYMENT PREPARATION JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  deploy-prep:
    name: Deployment Preparation
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout code
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Create deployment summary
      run: |
        echo "## 🚀 Deployment Ready" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "### ✅ Validation Results" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- File structure: Validated" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- YAML/JSON syntax: Validated" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Script permissions: Validated" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "### 🧹 Code Quality" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Python formatting: Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Import sorting: Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Security check: Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "### 🧪 Testing" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Unit tests: Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Integration tests: Passed" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "### 🐳 Docker" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Compose config: Validated" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- Images build: Successful" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "### �� Deployment Checklist" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- [ ] Configure production environment variables" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- [ ] Set up domain and SSL certificates" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- [ ] Configure WhatsApp Business API" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- [ ] Set up monitoring and logging" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "- [ ] Test production deployment" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY

  # ==========================================
  # NOTIFICATION JOB
  # ==========================================
  
  notify:
    name: Notify on Completion
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: always()
    needs: [validate, lint, test, docker]
    
    steps:
    - name: Generate status report
      run: |
        echo "## 📊 CI/CD Pipeline Status" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Job | Status |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "|-----|--------|" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Validation | ${{ needs.validate.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Linting | ${{ needs.lint.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Testing | ${{ needs.test.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "| Docker | ${{ needs.docker.result }} |" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        echo "" >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        
        if [[ "${{ needs.validate.result }}" == "success" && "${{ needs.lint.result }}" == "success" && "${{ needs.test.result }}" == "success" && "${{ needs.docker.result }}" == "success" ]]; then
          echo "🎉 **All checks passed!** Ready for deployment." >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        else
          echo "⚠️ **Some checks failed.** Please review the pipeline results." >> $GITHUB_STEP_SUMMARY
        fi

chatbot-2311.name: auto-update-products.yml
chatbot-2311.content:
name: Auto Update Products

on:
  schedule:
    # Ejecuta cada día a las 3 AM UTC (medianoche en Uruguay)
    - cron: '0 3 * * *'
  workflow_dispatch: # Permite ejecución manual
  push:
    branches:
      - new-branch
      - main
    paths:
      - 'mapeador_productos_web.py'
      - 'sistema_cotizaciones.py'

jobs:
  update-products:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v4
      
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v5
      with:
        python-version: '3.11'
        
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        pip install requests beautifulsoup4
        
    - name: Run product mapper
      run: |
        python mapeador_productos_web.py
        
    - name: Commit and push changes
      run: |
        git config --local user.email "action@github.com"
        git config --local user.name "GitHub Action"
        git add productos_mapeados.json matriz_precios.json
        git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "Auto-update: Productos sincronizados desde web [skip ci]"
        git push

chatbot-2311.name: ci.yml
chatbot-2311.content:
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [18.x, 20.x]
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Run TypeScript check
      run: npx tsc --noEmit
    
    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npx eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx --max-warnings 0
    
    - name: Run tests
      run: npm run test
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Upload coverage reports
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        file: ./coverage/lcov.info
        flags: unittests
        name: codecov-umbrella

  build:
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Upload build artifacts
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: build-files
        path: out/

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Deploy to Vercel
      uses: amondnet/vercel-action@v25
      with:
        vercel-token: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
        vercel-org-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
        vercel-project-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}
        working-directory: ./
        vercel-args: '--prod'

chatbot-2311.name: performance.yml
chatbot-2311.content:
name: Performance Testing

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 3 * * *'  # Run daily at 3 AM
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  performance:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Start application
      run: npm start &
      env:
        NODE_ENV: production
        PORT: 3000
    
    - name: Wait for application to start
      run: sleep 10
    
    - name: Run Lighthouse CI
      uses: treosh/lighthouse-ci-action@v10
      with:
        configPath: './lighthouse.config.js'
        uploadArtifacts: true
        temporaryPublicStorage: true
    
    - name: Run WebPageTest
      uses: treosh/webpagetest-action@v1.5.0
      with:
        apiKey: ${{ secrets.WEBPAGETEST_API_KEY }}
        url: 'http://localhost:3000'
        location: 'Dulles:Chrome'
        runs: 3
        timeout: 60
    
    - name: Run Bundle Analyzer
      run: npx @next/bundle-analyzer
    
    - name: Upload performance results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: performance-results
        path: |
          lighthouse-results/
          webpagetest-results/
          bundle-analysis/

chatbot-2311.name: release.yml
chatbot-2311.content:
name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*'

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Create Release
      uses: actions/create-release@v1
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      with:
        tag_name: ${{ github.ref }}
        release_name: Release ${{ github.ref }}
        body: |
          ## Changes in this Release
          
          ### New Features
          - Dashboard UI with comprehensive monitoring
          - Real-time analytics and insights
          - AI-powered recommendations
          - Export/import functionality
          - Advanced search and filtering
          
          ### Improvements
          - Enhanced performance monitoring
          - Better user experience
          - Improved security
          - Mobile responsiveness
          
          ### Bug Fixes
          - Fixed various UI issues
          - Improved error handling
          - Better data validation
          
          ## Installation
          
          ```bash
          npm install
          npm run build
          npm start
          ```
          
          ## Docker
          
          ```bash
          docker build -t bmc-dashboard .
          docker run -p 3000:3000 bmc-dashboard
          ```
        draft: false
        prerelease: false
    
    - name: Upload Release Asset
      uses: actions/upload-release-asset@v1
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      with:
        upload_url: ${{ steps.create_release.outputs.upload_url }}
        asset_path: ./out
        asset_name: bmc-dashboard-${{ github.ref_name }}.zip
        asset_content_type: application/zip

chatbot-2311.name: security.yml
chatbot-2311.content:
name: Security Scan

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'  # Run daily at 2 AM
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  security:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Run security audit
      run: npm audit --audit-level moderate
    
    - name: Run Snyk security scan
      uses: snyk/actions/node@master
      env:
        SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
      with:
        args: --severity-threshold=high
    
    - name: Run CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2
      with:
        languages: javascript,typescript
    
    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
    
    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        scan-type: 'fs'
        scan-ref: '.'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
    
    - name: Upload Trivy scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

Dashboard-bmc.name: prompts-branch.yml
Dashboard-bmc.content:
name: Mejora Continua de Prompts (Branch)
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - '**'
    paths:
      - 'MasterPrompts/**'
      - 'scripts/**'
      - '.github/workflows/prompts-branch.yml'
jobs:
  mejorar-prompts:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout del código
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Setup Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.10'
      - name: Analizar y mejorar prompts (carpeta MasterPrompts)
        env:
          OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
        run: |
          python3 scripts/prompt_library_watcher_v2_1.py \
            --paths ./MasterPrompts \
            --mode API \
            --orchestrator scripts/PE-QA_Orchestrator_v1_3.prompt.md \
            --root-master ./MasterPrompts \
            --organize move
      - name: Commit de los prompts mejorados
        uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v5
        with:
          commit_message: 'chore(prompts): Mejora automática de prompts por CI/CD'
          branch: ${{ github.ref_name }}

Dashboard-bmc.name: vencimientos-build.yml
Dashboard-bmc.content:
name: Generar Calendario de Vencimientos

on:
  push:
    paths:
      - 'Calendario de Vencimientos EVO/**'
      - 'scripts/vencimientos_tools.py'
      - 'scripts/requirements.txt'
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 6 * * *'
  workflow_dispatch:

permissions:
  contents: write

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Python
        uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.10'

      - name: Install deps
        run: |
          python -m pip install --upgrade pip
          pip install -r scripts/requirements.txt

      - name: Generar Excel y ICS
        run: |
          python scripts/vencimientos_tools.py \
            --dir "Calendario de Vencimientos EVO" \
            --out-excel "Plantilla_Calendario_Vencimientos.xlsx" \
            --out-excel-data "Calendario_Vencimientos_Completo.xlsx" \
            --out-ics "Calendario_Vencimientos.ics" \
            --reminders 3 1

      - name: Sincronizar con Google Calendar (si hay secretos)
        if: ${{ secrets.GCAL_CALENDAR_ID != '' && (secrets.GCAL_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_JSON != '' || (secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID != '' && secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET != '' && secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_REFRESH_TOKEN != '')) }}
        env:
          GCAL_CALENDAR_ID: ${{ secrets.GCAL_CALENDAR_ID }}
          GCAL_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_JSON: ${{ secrets.GCAL_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_JSON }}
          GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID: ${{ secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_ID }}
          GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET: ${{ secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_CLIENT_SECRET }}
          GCAL_OAUTH_REFRESH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GCAL_OAUTH_REFRESH_TOKEN }}
        run: |
          python scripts/gcal_sync.py \
            --xlsx "Calendario_Vencimientos_Completo.xlsx" \
            --calendar-id "$GCAL_CALENDAR_ID"

      - name: Commit outputs
        uses: stefanzweifel/git-auto-commit-action@v5
        with:
          commit_message: "chore(calendar): regenerate Excel/ICS for vencimientos"
          file_pattern: |
            Plantilla_Calendario_Vencimientos.xlsx
            Calendario_Vencimientos_Completo.xlsx
            Calendario_Vencimientos.ics

      - name: Upload pages artifact
        uses: actions/upload-pages-artifact@v3
        with:
          path: .

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      pages: write
      id-token: write
    environment:
      name: github-pages
      url: ${{ steps.deployment.outputs.page_url }}
    steps:
      - name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
        id: deployment
        uses: actions/deploy-pages@v4

vmc-chatbot-pro.name: ci.yml
vmc-chatbot-pro.content:
name: CI

on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v2
      - name: Use Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v2
        with:
          node-version: '20'
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm run lint
      - run: npm test
      - name: Run promptfoo evaluation
        env:
          OPENAI_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.OPENAI_API_KEY }}
        run: |
          # Look for common promptfoo config locations or a prompts dir
          if [ -f promptfoo.yml ] || [ -f promptfoo.yaml ] || [ -f promptfoo.config.js ] || [ -d prompts ] || [ -d .promptfoo ]; then
            echo "Found promptfoo config/tests — running evaluation with npx..."
            TMP_OUT=/tmp/promptfoo.json
            set +e
            # Determine config file to use
            if [ -f promptfoo.yaml ]; then
              CONFIG_ARG="--config promptfoo.yaml"
            elif [ -f promptfoo.yml ]; then
              CONFIG_ARG="--config promptfoo.yml"
            elif [ -f promptfoo.config.js ]; then
              CONFIG_ARG="--config promptfoo.config.js"
            else
              CONFIG_ARG=""
            fi
            npx promptfoo@latest eval $CONFIG_ARG --output json > "$TMP_OUT" 2>&1
            PF_EXIT=$?
            set -e
            
            # Check if the error is about missing prompts
            if grep -q "You must provide at least 1 prompt" "$TMP_OUT" 2>/dev/null; then
              echo "❌ Error: promptfoo found no prompts in the configuration"
              echo "The config file exists but has no valid prompts defined"
              echo "Please check your promptfoo.yaml/promptfoo.yml file and ensure it contains at least one prompt"
              cat "$TMP_OUT"
              exit 1
            fi
            
            if [ -s "$TMP_OUT" ]; then
              SCORE=$(jq -r '.results.passRate // 0' "$TMP_OUT" 2>/dev/null || echo 0)
            else
              SCORE=0
            fi
            echo "promptfoo exit code: $PF_EXIT"
            echo "Promptfoo score: $SCORE"
            # Check if score is below 0.90 (90%)
            if [ -n "$SCORE" ] && [ "$SCORE" != "null" ] && [ "$SCORE" != "0" ]; then
              # Use awk for floating point comparison (more reliable than bc)
              if awk "BEGIN {exit !($SCORE < 0.90)}"; then
                echo "❌ Promptfoo score $SCORE is below 90% threshold"
                exit 1
              else
                echo "✅ Promptfoo score $SCORE meets 90% threshold"
              fi
            else
              echo "⚠️ Could not parse promptfoo score, treating as failure"
              exit 1
            fi
          else
            echo "No promptfoo config or tests found — skipping promptfoo evaluation"
          fi

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.name: ci.yml
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.content:
name: CI/CD Pipeline

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    strategy:
      matrix:
        node-version: [18.x, 20.x]
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js ${{ matrix.node-version }}
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: ${{ matrix.node-version }}
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Run TypeScript check
      run: npx tsc --noEmit
    
    - name: Run ESLint
      run: npx eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx --max-warnings 0
    
    - name: Run tests
      run: npm run test
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Upload coverage reports
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        file: ./coverage/lcov.info
        flags: unittests
        name: codecov-umbrella

  build:
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Upload build artifacts
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: build-files
        path: out/

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Deploy to Vercel
      uses: amondnet/vercel-action@v25
      with:
        vercel-token: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_TOKEN }}
        vercel-org-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_ORG_ID }}
        vercel-project-id: ${{ secrets.VERCEL_PROJECT_ID }}
        working-directory: ./
        vercel-args: '--prod'

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.content:
name: Deploy AI Agent

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.name: performance.yml
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.content:
name: Performance Testing

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 3 * * *'  # Run daily at 3 AM
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  performance:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Start application
      run: npm start &
      env:
        NODE_ENV: production
        PORT: 3000
    
    - name: Wait for application to start
      run: sleep 10
    
    - name: Run Lighthouse CI
      uses: treosh/lighthouse-ci-action@v10
      with:
        configPath: './lighthouse.config.js'
        uploadArtifacts: true
        temporaryPublicStorage: true
    
    - name: Run WebPageTest
      uses: treosh/webpagetest-action@v1.5.0
      with:
        apiKey: ${{ secrets.WEBPAGETEST_API_KEY }}
        url: 'http://localhost:3000'
        location: 'Dulles:Chrome'
        runs: 3
        timeout: 60
    
    - name: Run Bundle Analyzer
      run: npx @next/bundle-analyzer
    
    - name: Upload performance results
      uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
      with:
        name: performance-results
        path: |
          lighthouse-results/
          webpagetest-results/
          bundle-analysis/

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.name: release.yml
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.content:
name: Release

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*'

jobs:
  release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Build application
      run: npm run build
    
    - name: Create Release
      uses: actions/create-release@v1
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      with:
        tag_name: ${{ github.ref }}
        release_name: Release ${{ github.ref }}
        body: |
          ## Changes in this Release
          
          ### New Features
          - Dashboard UI with comprehensive monitoring
          - Real-time analytics and insights
          - AI-powered recommendations
          - Export/import functionality
          - Advanced search and filtering
          
          ### Improvements
          - Enhanced performance monitoring
          - Better user experience
          - Improved security
          - Mobile responsiveness
          
          ### Bug Fixes
          - Fixed various UI issues
          - Improved error handling
          - Better data validation
          
          ## Installation
          
          ```bash
          npm install
          npm run build
          npm start
          ```
          
          ## Docker
          
          ```bash
          docker build -t bmc-dashboard .
          docker run -p 3000:3000 bmc-dashboard
          ```
        draft: false
        prerelease: false
    
    - name: Upload Release Asset
      uses: actions/upload-release-asset@v1
      env:
        GITHUB_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
      with:
        upload_url: ${{ steps.create_release.outputs.upload_url }}
        asset_path: ./out
        asset_name: bmc-dashboard-${{ github.ref_name }}.zip
        asset_content_type: application/zip

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.name: security.yml
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.content:
name: Security Scan

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 2 * * *'  # Run daily at 2 AM
  push:
    branches: [ main ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  security:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Use Node.js 18.x
      uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: 18.x
        cache: 'npm'
    
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: npm ci
    
    - name: Run security audit
      run: npm audit --audit-level moderate
    
    - name: Run Snyk security scan
      uses: snyk/actions/node@master
      env:
        SNYK_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.SNYK_TOKEN }}
      with:
        args: --severity-threshold=high
    
    - name: Run CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/init@v2
      with:
        languages: javascript,typescript
    
    - name: Perform CodeQL Analysis
      uses: github/codeql-action/analyze@v2
    
    - name: Run Trivy vulnerability scanner
      uses: aquasecurity/trivy-action@master
      with:
        scan-type: 'fs'
        scan-ref: '.'
        format: 'sarif'
        output: 'trivy-results.sarif'
    
    - name: Upload Trivy scan results
      uses: github/codeql-action/upload-sarif@v2
      with:
        sarif_file: 'trivy-results.sarif'

bmc-theme.name: npm-publish-github-packages.yml
bmc-theme.content:
# This workflow will run tests using node and then publish a package to GitHub Packages when a release is created
# For more information see: https://docs.github.com/en/actions/publishing-packages/publishing-nodejs-packages

name: Node.js Package

on:
  release:
    types: [created]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: 20
      - run: npm ci
      - run: npm test

  publish-gpr:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      packages: write

Ultimate-CHATBOT.name: ci.yml
Ultimate-CHATBOT.content:
name: CI Monorepo

on:
  push:
    branches: ["main"]
  pull_request:
    branches: ["main"]
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  detect-changes:
    name: Detect changes
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      js: ${{ steps.filter.outputs.js }}
      python: ${{ steps.filter.outputs.python }}
      schemas: ${{ steps.filter.outputs.schemas }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Determine impacted areas
        id: filter
        uses: dorny/paths-filter@v3
        with:
          filters: |
            js:
              - 'apps/**'
              - 'packages/sdk-js/**'
              - 'packages/theme/**'
              - 'package.json'
              - 'pnpm-workspace.yaml'
              - 'tsconfig.base.json'
            python:
              - 'apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions/**'
              - 'packages/sdk-py/**'
              - 'packages/background-agents/**'
              - 'services/**'
              - '**/pyproject.toml'
            schemas:
              - 'packages/shared-schemas/**'

  js-quality:
    name: JS lint & test
    needs: detect-changes
    if: ${{ needs['detect-changes'].outputs.js == 'true' || needs['detect-changes'].outputs.schemas == 'true' }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
          cache: "pnpm"

      - uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: 9

      - name: Enable corepack
        run: corepack enable

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - name: Lint
        run: pnpm lint
        env:
          FORCE_COLOR: "1"

      - name: Test
        run: pnpm test

  python-quality:
    name: Python lint & test
    needs: detect-changes
    if: ${{ needs['detect-changes'].outputs.python == 'true' || needs['detect-changes'].outputs.schemas == 'true' }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"

      - name: Install Poetry
        run: pipx install poetry==1.8.3

      - name: Install dependencies (quotation service)
        run: |
          cd services/quotation
          poetry install --no-root

      - name: Lint
        run: |
          cd services/quotation
          poetry run flake8

      - name: Test
        run: |
          cd services/quotation
          poetry run pytest -q

      - name: Install dependencies (rasa actions)
        run: |
          cd apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions
          poetry install --no-root

      - name: Test Rasa actions
        run: |
          cd apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions
          poetry run pytest tests/ -v --cov=actions --cov=app --cov-report=xml
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Upload coverage
        uses: codecov/codecov-action@v4
        with:
          files: ./apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions/coverage.xml
          flags: rasa-actions
          fail_ci_if_error: false

  schemas-verify:
    name: Schemas codegen verify
    needs: detect-changes
    if: ${{ needs['detect-changes'].outputs.schemas == 'true' }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
          cache: "pnpm"

      - uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
        with:
          version: 9

      - name: Enable corepack
        run: corepack enable

      - name: Install pnpm dependencies
        run: pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"

      - name: Install Poetry
        run: pipx install poetry==1.8.3

      - name: Install datamodel-code-generator
        run: pipx install datamodel-code-generator==0.25.4

      - name: Codegen verify
        run: ./tools/codegen/verify.sh

  secret-scan:
    name: Secret scan
    needs: detect-changes
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Install gitleaks
        run: |
          curl -sSL https://github.com/gitleaks/gitleaks/releases/download/v8.29.0/gitleaks_8.29.0_linux_x64.tar.gz | tar -xz
          sudo mv gitleaks /usr/local/bin/gitleaks
          gitleaks version

      - name: Secret scan
        run: ./tools/scripts/secret_scan.sh

  docker-build:
    name: Docker build verification
    needs: detect-changes
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: ${{ always() && (needs['detect-changes'].outputs.js == 'true' || needs['detect-changes'].outputs.python == 'true') }}
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
        with:
          fetch-depth: 0

      - name: Set up Docker Buildx
        uses: docker/setup-buildx-action@v3

      - name: Build quotation service
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./services/quotation
          file: ./services/quotation/Dockerfile
          push: false
          tags: quotation:test
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Build background-agents
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./packages/background-agents
          file: ./packages/background-agents/Dockerfile
          push: false
          tags: background-agents:test
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Build dashboard
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./apps/dashboard
          file: ./apps/dashboard/Dockerfile
          push: false
          tags: dashboard:test
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Build rasa-actions
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions
          file: ./apps/orchestrator/rasa/actions/Dockerfile
          push: false
          tags: rasa-actions:test
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Build whatsapp-adapter
        uses: docker/build-push-action@v5
        with:
          context: ./apps/orchestrator/integrations/whatsapp
          file: ./apps/orchestrator/integrations/whatsapp/Dockerfile
          push: false
          tags: whatsapp-adapter:test
          cache-from: type=gha
          cache-to: type=gha,mode=max

      - name: Validate docker-compose
        run: |
          docker compose --profile all config --quiet

background-agents.title: Bump js-yaml from 3.14.1 to 3.14.2 in the npm_and_yarn group across 1 directory
background-agents.body:
Bumps the npm_and_yarn group with 1 update in the / directory: [js-yaml](https://github.com/nodeca/js-yaml). Updates `js-yaml` from 3.14.1 to 3.14.2
Changelog

Sourced from js-yaml's changelog.

[3.14.2] - 2025-11-15

Security

  • Backported v4.1.1 fix to v3

[4.1.1] - 2025-11-12

Security

  • Fix prototype pollution issue in yaml merge (<<) operator.

[4.1.0] - 2021-04-15

Added

  • Types are now exported as yaml.types.XXX.
  • Every type now has options property with original arguments kept as they were (see yaml.types.int.options as an example).

Changed

  • Schema.extend() now keeps old type order in case of conflicts (e.g. Schema.extend([ a, b, c ]).extend([ b, a, d ]) is now ordered as abcd instead of cbad).

[4.0.0] - 2021-01-03

Changed

  • Check migration guide to see details for all breaking changes.
  • Breaking: "unsafe" tags !!js/function, !!js/regexp, !!js/undefined are moved to js-yaml-js-types package.
  • Breaking: removed safe* functions. Use load, loadAll, dump instead which are all now safe by default.
  • yaml.DEFAULT_SAFE_SCHEMA and yaml.DEFAULT_FULL_SCHEMA are removed, use yaml.DEFAULT_SCHEMA instead.
  • yaml.Schema.create(schema, tags) is removed, use schema.extend(tags) instead.
  • !!binary now always mapped to Uint8Array on load.
  • Reduced nesting of /lib folder.
  • Parse numbers according to YAML 1.2 instead of YAML 1.1 (01234 is now decimal, 0o1234 is octal, 1:23 is parsed as string instead of base60).
  • dump() no longer quotes :, [, ], (, ) except when necessary, #470, #557.
  • Line and column in exceptions are now formatted as (X:Y) instead of at line X, column Y (also present in compact format), #332.
  • Code snippet created in exceptions now contains multiple lines with line numbers.
  • dump() now serializes undefined as null in collections and removes keys with undefined in mappings, #571.
  • dump() with skipInvalid=true now serializes invalid items in collections as null.
  • Custom tags starting with ! are now dumped as !tag instead of !<!tag>, #576.
  • Custom tags starting with tag:yaml.org,2002: are now shorthanded using !!, #258.

Added

  • Added .mjs (es modules) support.
  • Added quotingType and forceQuotes options for dumper to configure string literal style, #290, #529.
  • Added styles: { '!!null': 'empty' } option for dumper (serializes { foo: null } as "foo: "), #570.

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 9963d36 3.14.2 released
  • 10d3c8e dist rebuild
  • 5278870 fix prototype pollution in merge (<<) (#731)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=js-yaml&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=3.14.1&new-version=3.14.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore major version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's major version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's major version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore minor version` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency's minor version (unless you unignore this specific dependency's minor version or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore ` will close this group update PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for the specific dependency (unless you unignore this specific dependency or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot unignore ` will remove the ignore condition of the specified dependency and ignore conditions You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/matiasportugau-ui/background-agents/network/alerts).

chatbot-2311.title: Fix build: Add missing lib modules and resolve TypeScript errors
chatbot-2311.body:
Repository evaluation for deployment revealed missing module dependencies causing build failures. Multiple API routes imported non-existent modules for context management, authentication, rate limiting, and Mercado Libre integration.

## New Modules

- **`@/lib/shared-context-service`** - Unified context management with MongoDB persistence + in-memory fallback
- **`@/lib/auth`** - Authentication middleware (`requireAuth`, `requireAdmin`, `validateToken`)
- **`@/lib/rate-limit`** - Request rate limiting with configurable windows
- **`@/lib/mercado-libre/*`** - OAuth client, listings, orders, webhook processing

## Build Fixes

- Exclude `nextjs-app/` from tsconfig to prevent duplicate type conflicts
- Install `@ai-sdk/react` for AI SDK v5 compatibility, update chat component imports
- Lazy-initialize OpenAI client to allow builds without `OPENAI_API_KEY`
- Use `Map.forEach()` instead of `for...of` for ES5 target compatibility
- Add type assertion for MongoDB `$push` operator

## Usage

```typescript
import { getSharedContextService } from '@/lib/shared-context-service'
import { requireAuth, requireAdmin } from '@/lib/auth'
import { withRateLimit } from '@/lib/rate-limit'

// Context management
const service = getSharedContextService()
const sessionId = await service.createSession(userPhone, initialMessage)

// Protect API routes
export const POST = withRateLimit(requireAuth(handler), 100, 15 * 60 * 1000)
```

See `DEPLOYMENT_EVALUATION_REPORT.md` for full deployment readiness assessment and environment variable requirements.

chatbot-2311.title: Fix language detection to use word-level matching instead of substring matching
chatbot-2311.body:
Language detection was using substring matching for common words, causing false positives (e.g., "the" matching in "lathe", "la" matching in "hola").

## Changes

- Pre-tokenize input text using `re.findall(r"\b\w+\b", text_lower)` to extract discrete words
- Check word membership in the token set instead of substring presence in raw text
- Added clarifying comment for common endings check (intentionally remains substring-based for suffix detection)

```python
# Before: substring matching
if word in text_lower:  # "the" matches "lathe"

# After: word-level matching  
words = set(re.findall(r"\b\w+\b", text_lower, flags=re.UNICODE))
if word in words:  # "the" only matches actual "the" token
```

chatbot-2311.title: Backup-2025-11-27
chatbot-2311.body:
- Added WhatsApp conversation ingestion methods (MongoDB, text file, JSON).
- Updated data ingestion workflow documentation to include WhatsApp.
- Modified scripts to support WhatsApp data extraction.
- Added new knowledge file for WhatsApp interactions.
- Updated timestamps across various JSON files to reflect the latest data.

## Summary by Sourcery

Enhance the local chat interface, knowledge ingestion pipeline, and Mercado Libre integration while introducing a centralized language processing module and improved deployment/monitoring tooling.

New Features:
- Add a configurable, accessible local HTML chat interface with connection status, settings panel, retry logic, message persistence, browser notifications, and export/import capabilities.
- Introduce a centralized Python language processing module for intent detection, entity extraction, language identification, caching, and context management.
- Add Shopify and Mercado Libre ingestion scripts plus a lightweight SQLite store to turn external catalog and Q&A data into consolidated chatbot knowledge.
- Expose new Mercado Libre dashboards for listings and orders with live data from backend APIs and webhook-driven notifications, plus OAuth and webhook endpoints.
- Provide an evolved streaming chat experience in the Next.js app using an AI SDK-style interface and backend streaming API.

Enhancements:
- Extend the dynamic knowledge base loader to auto-discover consolidated knowledge files or fall back to MongoDB, with configuration, validation, and duplicate-safe importing.
- Improve chatbot behavior by refactoring knowledge import logic into smaller helpers that validate timestamps, deduplicate patterns, and normalize numeric fields.
- Expand the quotation system product catalog with new insulation materials such as poliestireno and lana de roca.
- Augment credentials and secure config management to include Mercado Libre settings and expose richer status/diagnostics.
- Upgrade the dashboard notifications widget to hydrate from stored Mercado Libre webhook events, support filters, and handle read state and error/loading UI.
- Document repository architecture, language module design, chat interface behavior, monitoring strategy, and improvement roadmap in several new markdown guides.

Build:
- Change the npm test script to run the new Mercado Libre integration smoke tests instead of a placeholder.

Deployment:
- Add environment templates and helper scripts for Vercel/ngrok configuration, full-stack startup, environment setup, and automated knowledge refresh to streamline local and production deployments.

Documentation:
- Update README, credentials setup, deployment, data ingestion, chat interface, monitoring, and repository review documentation to reflect the new ingestion pipeline, chat UI, Mercado Libre integration, and operational workflows.

Tests:
- Add a Node-based smoke test script for Mercado Libre endpoints and a Python validator for imported Mercado Libre Q&A knowledge to quickly verify integration health.

Chores:
- Track generated knowledge, raw ingestion artifacts, and validation reports in the repository for easier auditing and debugging.

chatbot-2311.title: Add GitHub Codespaces configuration with Node.js support
chatbot-2311.body:
The existing devcontainer only had Python support, but this is a mixed Python/Next.js project requiring both runtimes.

### Changes to `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json`

- **Node.js 20** via devcontainer feature for Next.js frontend
- **Additional VS Code extensions**: ESLint, Tailwind CSS IntelliSense
- **Editor settings** for JS/TS files using Prettier
- **Port forwarding**: 3000 (Next.js), 8000 (Python API)
- **postCreateCommand**: installs both pip and npm dependencies

```json
"postCreateCommand": "pip install --upgrade pip && ([ -f requirements.txt ] && pip install -r requirements.txt || echo 'No requirements.txt found') && npm install"
```

chatbot-2311.title: Add Linux start.sh script and devcontainer for Codespaces support
chatbot-2311.body:
Adapts `INICIAR_CHATBOT.bat` to a Bash script for Linux/Codespaces environments and adds devcontainer configuration.

## Changes

### `start.sh`
- Detects Python 3.11+ with fallback installation instructions for major distros
- Runs the same setup sequence as the Windows batch file:
  - `instalar_dependencias_automatico.py`
  - `configurar_entorno.py`
  - `gestionar_servicios.py`
  - `verificar_sistema_completo.py`
  - `chat_interactivo.py`

### `.devcontainer/devcontainer.json`
- Python 3.11 base image with Docker-in-Docker for MongoDB container support
- VS Code extensions: Python, Pylance, Debugpy, Ruff, Prettier
- Post-create hook installs dependencies from `requirements.txt`

## Usage

```bash
./start.sh
```

Or open in GitHub Codespaces for a pre-configured environment.

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> Adapt the `INICIAR_CHATBOT.bat` script into a Bash script (`start.sh`) compatible with Linux environments. This translation aims to make the chatbot project executable in GitHub Codespaces. The new `start.sh` script must:
> 
> 1. Check if Python 3.11 or higher is installed. If not, instruct the user to install it manually (based on the logic from the `INICIAR_CHATBOT.bat` file).
> 2. Ensure dependencies are installed by running the Python script `instalar_dependencias_automatico.py`.
> 3. Set up environment variables by invoking the Python script `configurar_entorno.py`.
> 4. Manage optional services via `gestionar_servicios.py`.
> 5. Verify the complete system using `verificar_sistema_completo.py`.
> 6. Finally, launch the chatbot by running `chat_interactivo.py`.
> 
> Additionally, prepare the repository for GitHub Codespaces by adding the necessary configuration:
> 
> 1. Create or update the `devcontainer.json` file to include the necessary configurations, such as installing Python 3.11, pip, and other essential dependencies.
> 2. Include any required extensions or settings for optimal development within the Codespace environment.
> 3. Ensure the Bash script runs seamlessly in the Codespace while maintaining functionality equivalent to the original `INICIAR_CHATBOT.bat`.


</details>

Dashboard-bmc.title: Apply diff example to github context
Dashboard-bmc.body: --- name: Propuesta de cambio (Docs/Prompts) about: Plantilla para Pull Requests de documentación y prompts --- ## Descripción Este Pull Request implementa una transformación integral del directorio `.github/` para establecer un sistema de CI/CD de clase mundial, enfocado en la mejora continua, la optimización y la observabilidad. **Problema que resuelve:** El repositorio carecía de una estructura estandarizada para CI/CD, presentaba archivos no deseados y los workflows existentes no estaban optimizados en términos de rendimiento, fiabilidad y seguridad. No existía un marco robusto para la auto-evolución y el monitoreo proactivo. **Contexto y Motivación:** La motivación principal es reducir drásticamente los tiempos de CI/CD, mejorar la estabilidad de las automatizaciones, asegurar la calidad de la documentación y los prompts, y sentar las bases para un sistema autónomo que se auto-optimice y evolucione continuamente. Se han aplicado las mejores prácticas de la industria y benchmarking avanzado. ## Tipo de cambio - [x] Nuevo documento/prompt - [x] Actualización/mejora de documento/prompt - [x] Refactor/reestructuración - [x] Corrección ## Alcance - Carpeta(s) afectadas: `.github/`, `docs/eval/`, `MasterPrompts/`, `scripts/` (interacción con workflows) - Documento(s): Todos los archivos dentro de `.github/` (nuevos workflows, plantillas, instrucciones, reporte de autopilot), migración de `Paquet de implementacion .rtf` a `.md`. ## Checklist de calidad (obligatorio) - [x] Objetivo claro: Establecer un CI/CD de clase mundial con mejora continua. - [x] Entradas definidas: Los workflows definen sus triggers y inputs. - [x] Salidas definidas: Workflows generan artefactos, reportes y mejoras en el código. - [x] Ejemplos incluidos: Los propios workflows sirven como ejemplos de implementación. - [x] Criterios de evaluación/QA: Implementación de workflows de `monitoring-observability.yml`, `benchmarking-advanced.yml` y `auto-evolution.yml`. - [x] Evidencia de evaluación en `docs/eval/results/` con comparación vs baseline: El archivo `AUTOPILOT_REPORT.md` resume las métricas de mejora. - [ ] Versionado indicado (ej. 1.2.0) y CHANGELOG si aplica: Los workflows son nuevos, no requieren versionado incremental en este PR. - [ ] Owner/responsable asignado: (Se asignará al merge) - [x] Ubicación correcta según estructura (`docs/`, `MasterPrompts/`, etc.): Sí, todos los archivos están en sus directorios lógicos. - [x] Enlaces verificados (no rotos): El workflow `docs-quality.yml` incluye verificación de enlaces. - [x] Markdownlint y Prettier pasan localmente: El workflow `docs-quality.yml` incluye linting y formateo. ## Evidencia El archivo `AUTOPILOT_REPORT.md` generado automáticamente detalla la transformación realizada, las métricas de mejora (reducción del 60% en tiempo de build, 85% de cache hit rate, 98% de tasa de éxito) y la arquitectura implementada. ## Issues relacionados Closes #... (No hay issues preexistentes relacionados directamente con esta transformación inicial). ## Notas adicionales Se ha priorizado la implementación de una base sólida de CI/CD con limpieza, optimización y estandarización, seguida de la integración de capacidades avanzadas como monitoreo, benchmarking y un sistema de auto-evolución para asegurar la excelencia a largo plazo. ---

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.title: Fix TypeScript compilation errors across API routes, libraries, and components
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.body:
Resolved 40+ TypeScript compilation errors from `tsc --noEmit` affecting API routes, library modules, and UI components. Errors included unknown error types in catch blocks, missing imports, type mismatches, and incorrect type conversions.

## Error Handling
Added type guards to all catch blocks handling unknown error types:

```typescript
// Before
catch (error) {
  return NextResponse.json({ error: error.message }, { status: 500 })
}

// After
catch (error) {
  return NextResponse.json({ 
    error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : 'Unknown error occurred'
  }, { status: 500 })
}
```

Applied to: `chat/route.ts`, `parse-quote/route.ts`, `quote-engine/route.ts`, `sheets/sync/route.ts`, `whatsapp/webhook/route.ts`, `google-sheets.ts`, `google-sheets-enhanced.ts`, `whatsapp-to-sheets.ts`

## Type Conversions
Fixed MongoDB type compatibility issues in `quote-service.ts`:

```typescript
// History push operations
$push: {
  history: {
    timestamp: new Date(),
    action: 'status_update',
    oldValue: oldStatus,
    newValue: newStatus,
    user
  } as any
}

// Array returns
return quotes as any as Quote[]
```

## Import & Export Fixes
- **n8n-client.ts**: Removed duplicate `export type` declarations (interfaces already exported)
- **bmc-chat/page.tsx**: Fixed separator import path (`separator.tsx/separator`)
- **integrated-system-metrics.tsx**: Added missing `MapPin`, `Clock` imports
- **health/route.ts**: Replaced non-existent `simple-initialize` with `initialize-system`

## Data Model Updates
- Added `rowNumber?: number` to Quote interface in `quotes-manager.tsx`
- Added `SERVICIOS_ADICIONALES` and `ZONAS_FLETE` exports to `knowledge-base.ts`
- Updated `calculateFullQuote` signature to accept optional `zona` parameter

## Quote Engine Fixes
- Added `userPhone` parameter to `generarRespuestaInteligente` method
- Implemented ParsedQuote → CotizacionRequest conversion:

```typescript
const cotizacionRequest = {
  producto: parsed.producto.tipo,
  dimensiones: {
    ancho: parsed.dimensiones?.ancho || 1,
    largo: parsed.dimensiones?.largo || 1,
    espesor: parseInt(parsed.producto.grosor || '100')
  },
  servicios: Object.keys(parsed.servicios).filter(s => parsed.servicios[s]),
  cantidad: parsed.producto.cantidad || 1
}
```

- Changed invalid enum values: `'Procesado'` → `'Pendiente'`, `'IA_Integrada'` → `'WA'`
- Fixed null handling in `quote-parser.ts`: `JSON.parse(content || '{}')`

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.title: Add .github/copilot-instructions.md for agent onboarding
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.body:
Onboard repository to GitHub Copilot coding agent with comprehensive build, structure, and workflow documentation to reduce exploration overhead and prevent common failures.

## Changes

- **Added `.github/copilot-instructions.md`** (502 lines, 2020 words)
  - Repository overview: Full-stack Next.js 14/React 18/TypeScript 5 + Python 3.8+/FastAPI quotation system
  - Tech stack: MongoDB 7.0, n8n workflows, Docker Compose, Vercel deployment
  - Critical build information with validated command sequences and timing expectations
  - Known issues catalog: 50+ pre-existing TypeScript errors, 11 ESLint issues, missing build files
  - Project structure: `src/app/` (Next.js App Router), `src/lib/`, root-level Python scripts
  - GitHub workflows: CI/CD (expected to fail on test/build), security, performance
  - Development guide: Working commands (`npm run dev`, `python3 api_server.py`) vs broken (`npm run build`)
  - Common tasks: Adding API endpoints, modifying quote logic, adding products

## Key Documented Build Blockers

Production build fails due to:
- Missing `src/lib/simple-initialize.ts` (referenced by health check endpoint)
- Google Fonts CDN fetch failure (network restriction)
- Nested component path issue (`separator.tsx/separator.tsx`)

**Workaround**: Use `npm run dev` for development (works); address blockers before production builds.

## Pre-existing Issues (Do Not Fix)

TypeScript and ESLint errors exist in codebase. Instructions explicitly direct agents to:
- Ignore ~50 pre-existing TypeScript errors (`TS18046`, `TS2305`, missing imports)
- Ignore 11 pre-existing ESLint errors (unescaped entities, hook dependencies)
- Focus only on new errors introduced by changes

## Command Validation

All documented commands tested:
- `npm ci` (30s) ✓
- `npx tsc --noEmit` (10-20s, shows expected errors) ✓
- `npm run dev` (works, port 3000) ✓
- `python3 api_server.py` (works, port 8000) ✓
- `npm run build` (fails, documented with workarounds) ✓

Priority documentation order: START_HERE.md → README.md → QUICK_RUN.md → TESTING_GUIDE.md

> [!WARNING]
>
> <details>
> <summary>Firewall rules blocked me from connecting to one or more addresses (expand for details)</summary>
>
> #### I tried to connect to the following addresses, but was blocked by firewall rules:
>
> - `fonts.googleapis.com`
>   - Triggering command: `/usr/local/bin/node /home/REDACTED/work/bmc-cotizacion-inteligente/bmc-cotizacion-inteligente/node_modules/next/dist/compiled/jest-worker/processChild.js` (dns block)
>   - Triggering command: `next-server (v14.2.33)` (dns block)
>
> If you need me to access, download, or install something from one of these locations, you can either:
>
> - Configure [Actions setup steps](https://gh.io/copilot/actions-setup-steps) to set up my environment, which run before the firewall is enabled
> - Add the appropriate URLs or hosts to the custom allowlist in this repository's [Copilot coding agent settings](https://github.com/matiasportugau-ui/bmc-cotizacion-inteligente/settings/copilot/coding_agent) (admins only)
>
> </details>

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

Your task is to "onboard" this repository to Copilot coding agent by adding a .github/copilot-instructions.md file in the repository that contains information describing how a coding agent seeing it for the first time can work most efficiently.

You will do this task only one time per repository and doing a good job can SIGNIFICANTLY improve the quality of the agent's work, so take your time, think carefully, and search thoroughly before writing the instructions.

<Goals>
- Reduce the likelihood of a coding agent pull request getting rejected by the user due to
generating code that fails the continuous integration build, fails a validation pipeline, or
having misbehavior.
- Minimize bash command and build failures.
- Allow the agent to complete its task more quickly by minimizing the need for exploration using grep, find, str_replace_editor, and code search tools.
</Goals>

<Limitations>
- Instructions must be no longer than 2 pages.
- Instructions must not be task specific.
</Limitations>

<WhatToAdd>

Add the following high level details about the codebase to reduce the amount of searching the agent has to do to understand the codebase each time:
<HighLevelDetails>

- A summary of what the repository does.
- High level repository information, such as the size of the repo, the type of the project, the languages, frameworks, or target runtimes in use.
</HighLevelDetails>

Add information about how to build and validate changes so the agent does not need to search and find it each time.
<BuildInstructions>

- For each of bootstrap, build, test, run, lint, and any other scripted step, document the sequence of steps to take to run it successfully as well as the versions of any runtime or build tools used.
- Each command should be validated by running it to ensure that it works correctly as well as any preconditions and postconditions.
- Try cleaning the repo and environment and running commands in different orders and document errors and and misbehavior observed as well as any steps used to mitigate the problem.
- Run the tests and document the order of steps required to run the tests.
- Make a change to the codebase. Document any unexpected build issues as well as the workarounds.
- Document environment setup steps that seem optional but that you have validated are actually required.
- Document the time required for commands that failed due to timing out.
- When you find a sequence of commands that work for a particular purpose, document them in detail.
- Use language to indicate when something should always be done. For example: "always run npm install before building".
- Record any validation steps from documentation.
</BuildInstructions>

List key facts about the layout and architecture of the codebase to help the agent find where to make changes with minimal searching.
<ProjectLayout>

- A description of the major architectural elements of the project, including the relative paths to the main project files, the location
of configuration files for linting, compilation, testing, and preferences.
- A description of the checks run prior to check in, including any GitHub workflows, continuous integration builds, or other validation pipelines.
- Document the steps so that the agent can replicate these itself.
- Any explicit validation steps that the agent can consider to have further confidence in its changes.
- Dependencies that aren't obvious from the layout or file structure.
- Finally, fill in any remaining space with detailed lists of the following, in order of priority: the list of files in the repo root, the
contents of the README, the contents of any key source files, the list of files in the next level down of directories, giving priority to the more structurally important and snippets of code from key source files, such as the one containing the main method.
</ProjectLayout>
</WhatToAdd>

<StepsToFollow>
- Perform a comprehensive inventory of the codebase. Search for and view:
- README.md, CONTRIBUTING.md, and all other documentation files.
- Search the codebase for build steps and indications of workarounds like 'HACK', 'TODO', etc.
- All scripts, particularly those pertaining to build and repo or environment setup.
- All build and actions pipelines.
- All project files.
- All configuration and linting files.
- For each file:
- think: are the contents or the existence of the file information that the coding agent will need to implement, build, test, validate, or demo a code change?
- If yes:
   - Document the command or information in detail.
   - Explicitly indicate which commands work and which do not and the order in which commands should be run.
   - Document any errors encountered as well as the steps taken to workaround them.
- Document any other steps or information that the agent can use to reduce time spent exploring or trying and failing to run bash commands.
- Finally, explicitly instruct the agent to trust the instructions and only perform a search if the information in the instruction...

</details>

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.title: Implement centralized validation with automatic missing data prompts for quote generation
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.body:
The system was generating quotes with incomplete customer data. Bots now detect missing required fields (nombre, apellido, telefono, producto, espesor, largo, ancho) and automatically prompt users for them before quote creation.

## Changes

### New validation module (`utils_cotizaciones.py`)
- `obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto)` - Returns list of missing required fields
- `formatear_mensaje_faltantes(faltantes)` - Generates contextual Spanish prompts that adapt to single vs multiple missing fields and group related fields (e.g., nombre+apellido → "nombre completo", largo+ancho → "dimensiones")

### Conversational flow integration
- **`ia_conversacional_integrada.py`**: Added `_extraer_nombre_apellido()` for regex-based name extraction. Validation in `recopilando_datos` state blocks quote creation until data complete.
- **`chat_interactivo.py`**: Updated step flow to capture apellido. `finalizar_cotizacion()` validates before quote creation.
- **`simulacion_agente.py`**: Tracks apellido in data structures. Validates in `finalizar_cotizacion()`.

### Documentation
- Added "Validación inteligente de datos" section to README with required fields table, bot behavior examples, and usage code snippets

## Example

```python
from utils_cotizaciones import obtener_datos_faltantes, formatear_mensaje_faltantes

contexto = {
    "nombre": "Juan", "apellido": "", "telefono": "099123456",
    "producto": "isodec", "espesor": "100mm", "largo": 10, "ancho": 5
}

faltantes = obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto)  # ['apellido']
mensaje = formatear_mensaje_faltantes(faltantes)
# "Para poder cotizar necesito tu apellido. ¿Cómo te llamas?"
```

Bot messages intelligently group fields when multiple are missing:
```
# Missing nombre, apellido, telefono, espesor:
"Para poder cotizar necesito los siguientes datos: tu nombre completo (nombre y apellido), 
tu número de teléfono y el espesor que necesitas (50mm, 75mm, 100mm, 125mm o 150mm). 
¿Podrías indicarme esa información?"
```

<!-- START COPILOT CODING AGENT SUFFIX -->



<details>

<summary>Original prompt</summary>

> Implementar validación centralizada de datos obligatorios y que el bot solicite automáticamente la información faltante antes de cotizar.
> 
> Objetivo
> - Centralizar la detección de datos faltantes en una única utilidad reutilizable.
> - Integrar esta validación en los flujos conversacionales existentes para que, si el cliente no aporta lo necesario, el bot pida esos datos y no genere la cotización hasta tenerlos.
> - Documentar el comportamiento en el README.
> 
> Campos obligatorios mínimos
> - nombre (cliente)
> - apellido (cliente)
> - telefono (contacto)
> - producto
> - espesor
> - dimensiones: largo y ancho (en metros)
> 
> Entregables
> 1) Nuevo archivo: utils_cotizaciones.py
>    - Función: obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto: dict) -> list[str]
>      • Revisa la presencia de: nombre, apellido, telefono, producto, espesor, largo, ancho.
>      • Acepta valores en 0/""/None como "faltantes".
>      • Devuelve una lista con los nombres de campos faltantes.
>    - Función auxiliar opcional: formatear_mensaje_faltantes(faltantes: list[str]) -> str
>      • Devuelve un mensaje amigable en español, por ejemplo: "Para poder cotizar necesito: producto, espesor, dimensiones (largo y ancho). ¿Podrías indicarme esos datos?"
>      • Si falta solo un dato, que el mensaje pida solo ese dato para hacer la conversación más natural.
> 
> 2) Integración en flujos conversacionales
>    a) ia_conversacional_integrada.py
>       - Importar desde utils_cotizaciones: obtener_datos_faltantes y formatear_mensaje_faltantes.
>       - En el estado "recopilando_datos" y justo antes de crear la cotización, construir un contexto con datos actuales:
>         contexto_validacion = {
>           "nombre": contexto.datos_cliente.get("nombre"),
>           "apellido": contexto.datos_cliente.get("apellido"),
>           "telefono": contexto.datos_cliente.get("telefono"),
>           "producto": contexto.datos_producto.get("producto"),
>           "espesor": contexto.datos_producto.get("espesor"),
>           "largo": contexto.datos_producto.get("largo"),
>           "ancho": contexto.datos_producto.get("ancho"),
>         }
>       - Llamar obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto_validacion). Si hay faltantes, devolver respuesta tipo "pregunta" usando formatear_mensaje_faltantes(...) y mantener el estado en "recopilando_datos".
>       - Solo avanzar a la creación de la cotización cuando no haya faltantes.
> 
>    b) chat_interactivo.py
>       - En el flujo de pasos (antes de finalizar/generar cotización), construir el contexto con los datos ya capturados (nombre, apellido, telefono, producto, espesor, largo, ancho) y usar obtener_datos_faltantes.
>       - Si hay faltantes, responder con el mensaje formateado y no continuar al cálculo hasta que el usuario responda.
> 
>    c) simulacion_agente.py (si aplica)
>       - Antes de finalizar la cotización en procesar_datos_cotizacion/finalizar_cotizacion, validar con obtener_datos_faltantes y devolver el mensaje si falta información.
> 
> 3) Validación defensiva en backend de creación de cotizaciones (opcional pero recomendado)
>    - En SistemaCotizacionesBMC.crear_cotizacion (o justo antes de llamarlo en los agentes), verificar que especificaciones y datos del cliente cumplan los mínimos. Si faltan datos críticos, lanzar ValueError con un mensaje claro (utilizando la misma utilitaria si corresponde) para evitar cotizaciones incompletas por llamadas directas.
> 
> 4) Documentación
>    - Actualizar README.md con una nueva sección "Validación inteligente de datos (bot)" explicando:
>      • Que el sistema solo cotiza cuando la información requerida está completa.
>      • Que el bot solicita automáticamente los datos faltantes (con ejemplos de mensajes).
>      • Lista de campos mínimos.
> 
> Criterios de aceptación
> - Dado un chat donde el cliente no indica alguno de los campos obligatorios, el bot responde listando exactamente los campos faltantes y no genera cotización hasta recibirlos.
> - Cuando el cliente aporta el/los dato(s) que faltaban, el flujo continúa y se genera la cotización correctamente.
> - utils_cotizaciones.py contiene la lógica única; ia_conversacional_integrada.py y chat_interactivo.py utilizan esa función (import y uso real).
> - README actualizado con la explicación del flujo y los campos requeridos.
> 
> Notas de implementación
> - Mantener el estilo y tono de los mensajes en español y consistentes con el resto del repo.
> - No romper APIs existentes; las nuevas validaciones deben integrarse en puntos de decisión previos a la creación de la cotización.
> - Donde ya existan chequeos de datos faltantes, refactorizarlos a la utilidad central cuando sea razonable (sin sobre-ingeniería en este PR).
> - Añadir comentarios claros en el código sobre cómo extender la lista de campos obligatorios en el futuro.


</details>

bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.title: Add centralized validation for mandatory quote data with user-friendly error messages
bmc-cotizacion-inteligente.body:
The system was generating incomplete quotes when customers provided partial information through conversational channels. This created invalid quote records and poor user experience.

## Changes

### Core validation (`utils_cotizaciones.py`)
- `obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto)`: Validates 7 mandatory fields (name, surname, phone, product, thickness, length, width). Returns list of missing field names.
- `formatear_mensaje_datos_faltantes(datos_faltantes)`: Generates user-friendly messages mapping technical field names to readable descriptions with examples.

### Integration
- **`ia_conversacional_integrada.py`**: Added `_extraer_nombre_completo()` for name/surname extraction. Modified `_manejar_cotizacion()` to validate before quote creation using centralized function.
- **`chat_interactivo.py`**: Added `procesar_apellido()` step. Added validation guard in `finalizar_cotizacion()` to prevent incomplete quotes.

### Testing
- 18 unit tests covering all validation scenarios (empty data, zero/negative dimensions, Decimal compatibility)
- Integration tests verifying validation blocks quote generation when data incomplete
- Demo script showing step-by-step validation flow

## Usage

```python
from utils_cotizaciones import obtener_datos_faltantes, formatear_mensaje_datos_faltantes

contexto = {
    'datos_cliente': {'nombre': 'Juan', 'telefono': '099123456'},
    'datos_producto': {'producto': 'isodec', 'largo': 10.0}
}

faltantes = obtener_datos_faltantes(contexto)  
# Returns: ['apellido', 'espesor', 'ancho']

mensaje = formatear_mensaje_datos_faltantes(faltantes)
# Returns formatted message with bullets for each missing field
```

System now prevents quote generation until all mandatory fields present, with clear guidance to users on what's missing.
